result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah Jared Peete was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 11/11/2017.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer user or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

**Court will consider motion for expungement after three years if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no futher violations of the law (arrests), obtain DL, pay costs, obtain a job.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 11/11/17.  If not paid, civil judgment shall be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Jared Peete

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
- signed and filed. 
THE COURT ORDERS: The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs

Sentencing proceeded as to Count THREE: 

 The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 38 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 38  days time served.

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs, fees  and  dna surcharges by 11-11-2017 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

All parties in receipt of PSI.

AS TO COUNT TWO:

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for THREE YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of ONE YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of TWO YEARS consecutive to any other sentence, credit for ZERO days.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is  eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 11-11-2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 11-11-2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Court will consider motion for expungement  after 3 years if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law(arrests), obtain DL , pay costs, obtain a job.

Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS TWO AND THREE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED AND READ IN. 

Court ordered a PSI for sentencing.  Same bail. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-11-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense withdrew request for a motion hearing this date.  Defense reuest for a plea date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea hearing scheduled for 09-15-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for motion and  jury trial in Branch 47. Defense motion to be filed within one week of today and State's response within two weeks of today. .lr  Jury trial scheduled for 10-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Isaiah Jared Peete not in court, in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is in trial and there are no spin courts available. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 8/11/2014 at 1:30 pm.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in court with attorney Thomas J Kasen.  Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in custody. Karen Behling for  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is now requesting a trial date. Defense counsel is requesting a scheduling date after the rotation with the new Judge. Defendant is currently serving a sentence. Case is calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/5/2014 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Isaiah Jared Peete not in court, in custody. Karyn Behling for Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/7/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant had originally submitted a Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver Form, but requested to have a Preliminary Hearing. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF3426 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:John Ivy-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court entered a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.

Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in custody.  Marissa Santiago for Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Isaiah Jared Peete in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
